title: Charged particle moves through magnetic field

content.question: Each of the figures below shows the path of a charged particle moving in the plane of the page in a magnetic field that is perpendicular to the page. If the mass, speed, and charge of the particles are the same, in which case does the field have the greatest magnitude?

choices.label: Option A shows the directional arrow continuing to the right and curving slightly up. The arrow exits the magnetic field at the right edge just below the second row of Xs.
Option B shows the directional arrow continuing to the right and curving up significantly. The arrow exits the magnetic field at the top edge just to the right of the fifth column of Xs. u2028

Option C shows the directional arrow continuing to the right and curving up significantly in an arc that is a quarter of a circle. The arrow exists the magnetic field at the top just to the right of the third column of Xs.

Option D shows the directional arrow continuing to the right and curving up significantly in an arc that is not quite a half circle. The arrow exits the magnetic field at the top just to the right of the second column of Xs.u2028

content.answer: Option D shows the directional arrow continuing to the right and curving up significantly in an arc that is not quite a half circle. The arrow exits the magnetic field at the top just to the right of the second column of Xs.u2028
